sen.j: 奈良国立博物館（ならこくりつはくぶつかん）は、奈良県奈良市登大路町にある、独立行政法人国立文化財機構が運営する博物館である。
sen.e: Nara National Museum is a museum in Noborioji-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture operated by an Independent Administrative Institution, National Institutes for Cultural Heritage.
Nara National Museum is a museum in Noborioji-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture operated by an Independent Administrative Institution, National Institutes for Cultural Heritage.
Nara National Museum is a museum in Noborioji-cho, Nara City, Nara Prefecture operated by an Independent Administrative Institution, National Institutes for Cultural Heritage.

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Summary
Summary
Summary

sen.j: 仏教美術を中心とした文化財の収集、保管、研究、展示を行うとともに、講演会や出版活動などを通じた普及活動を行うことを主たる活動内容としている。
sen.e: As the main activities, the museum has been conducting promoting activities through lecture presentations and publications, etc., as well as collecting, preserving, studying and exhibiting cultural properties centered on Buddhist arts.

As the main activities, the museum has been conducting promotional activities through lecture presentations and publications, etc., as well as collecting, preserving, studying and exhibiting cultural properties centered on Buddhist art.

As the main activities, the museum has been conducting promotional activities through lecture presentations and publications, etc., as well as collecting, preserving, studying and exhibiting cultural properties centered on Buddhist art.

sen.j: 展示施設は本館、本館付属棟、東新館、西新館、地下回廊がある。
sen.e: As the exhibition facilities, there are Original Museum Building, Annex attached to the Original Museum Building, East Wing, West Wing and Lower Level Passageway.
sen.cmt: http://www.narahaku.go.jp/english/shisetu/shi-index_e.htmを参照しています。なお「本館付属棟」は"Annex attached to the Original Museum Building"と訳出しています。
sen.e: As the exhibition facilities, there are Original Museum Building, Annex attached to the Original Museum Building, East Wing, West Wing and Lower Level Passageway.
As the exhibition facilities, there are Original Museum Building, Annex attached to the Original Museum Building, East Wing, West Wing and Lower Level Passageway.

sen.j: このうち本館は、赤坂離宮（迎賓館）などを手がけた宮廷建築家・片山東熊の設計により1894年（明治27年）竣工したもので、明治期の洋風建築の代表例として国の重要文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: Of the facilities, the Original Museum Building was completed in 1894 after the design of a court architect, Tokuma KATAYAMA who had designed Akasaka Rikyu (the Guest House in Akasaka), etc., and has been designated as an important cultural property as a representative example of western-style architecture in Meiji era.

Of the facilities, the Original Museum Building was completed in 1894 after the design of a court architect, Tokuma KATAYAMA who had designed Akasaka Rikyu (the Guest House in Akasaka), etc., and has been designated an important cultural property as a representative example of western-style architecture of the Meiji era.

Of the facilities, the Original Museum Building was completed in 1894 after the design of a court architect, Tokuma KATAYAMA who had designed Akasaka Rikyu (the Guest House in Akasaka), etc., and has been designated an important cultural property as a representative example of western-style architecture of the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: designated as→designated、Meiji era→Meiji periodとしました。

sen.j: 展示品は館蔵品のほか、奈良県下を中心とした社寺や個人からの寄託品も多い。
sen.e: The exhibits include many articles deposited with the museum by Shinto shrines, temples and people centered in Nara Prefecture, as well as those possessed by the museum.
The exhibits include many articles deposited with the museum by Shinto shrines, temples and people centered in Nara Prefecture, as well as those possessed by the museum.
The exhibits include many articles deposited with the museum by Shinto shrines, temples and people centered in Nara Prefecture, as well as those possessed by the museum.

sen.j: 毎年秋に実施される「正倉院展」の会場でもある。
sen.e: The museum is also the site of 'Shosoin ten' (Exhibition of Shosoin Treasures) held every autumn.
The museum is also the site of 'Shosoin ten' (Exhibition of Shosoin Treasures) held every autumn.
The museum is also the site of 'Shosoin ten' (Exhibition of Shosoin Treasures) held every autumn.
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正

sen.j: 1980年に新設された仏教美術資料研究センターでは、仏教美術に関連する資料の作成・収集・整理・保管を行っており、毎週水・金曜日に限定して一般に公開される。
sen.e: Buddhist Art Library and Research Center newly built in 1980 has been preparing, collecting, organizing and preserving materials relating to Buddhist arts, which are opened to the public only on every Wednesday and Friday.

Buddhist Art Library and Research Center newly built in 1980 has been preparing, collecting, organizing and preserving materials related to Buddhist art, which are opened to the public only on every Wednesday and Friday.

Buddhist Art Library and Research Center newly built in 1980 has been preparing, collecting, organizing and preserving materials related to Buddhist art, which are opened to the public only on every Wednesday and Friday.

sen.j: 1983年から奈良国立博物館の所属になった建物（国の重要文化財）は、1902年（明治35年）に竣工した関野貞設計の旧奈良県物産陳列所である。
sen.e: It is the former Nara Prefecture Products Display Center (important cultural property) completed in 1902 after the design of Tadashi SEKINO that has belonged to Nara National Museum since 1983.
It is the former Nara Prefecture Products Display Center (important cultural property) completed in 1902 after the design of Tadashi SEKINO that has belonged to Nara National Museum since 1983.
It is the former Nara Prefecture Products Display Center (important cultural property) completed in 1902 after the design of Tadashi SEKINO that has belonged to Nara National Museum since 1983.

sen.j: 沿革
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 館は1895年（明治28年）、帝国奈良博物館として開館した。
sen.e: The museum opened as Imperial Museum of Nara in 1895.
The museum opened as Imperial Museum of Nara in 1895.
The museum opened as Imperial Museum of Nara in 1895.

sen.j: 開館までの前史として、奈良博覧会の存在を看過することはできない。
sen.e: We can't overlook the existence of Nara Exhibition as a history prior to the inauguration of the museum.
We can't overlook the existence of Nara Exhibition as a history prior to the inauguration of the museum.
We can not overlook the existence of Nara Exhibition as a history prior to the inauguration of the museum.

sen.j: 1874年（明治7年）、当時の奈良県令・藤井千尋が中心となり、官民合同の奈良博覧会社が設立された。
sen.e: In 1874, Nara Exhibition Company which would be operated jointly by public and private sectors was established by the Kenrei (governor) of Nara Prefecture at that time, Chihiro FUJII and the people around him.

In 1874, Nara Exhibition Company, which was operated jointly by public and private sectors, was established by the Kenrei (governor) of Nara Prefecture at that time, Chihiro FUJII and the people around him.

In 1874, Nara Exhibition Company, which was operated jointly by public and private sectors, was established by the Kenrei (governor) of Nara Prefecture at that time, Chihiro FUJII and the people around him.

sen.j: 翌1875年（明治8年）開催された第1回奈良博覧会は、東大寺大仏殿と周囲の回廊を会場として、正倉院宝物をはじめ、社寺や個人から出品された書画、古器物、動植物標本、機械類などを陳列した。
sen.e: The 1st Nara Exhibition held in the next year, 1875 exhibited calligraphic works and paintings, antique wears, specimens of animals and plants and machinery, etc. displayed by Shinto shrines, temples and people, including Shosoin treasures, using Daibutsu-den Hall (the Great Buddha hall) of Todai-ji Temple and corridors around the hall as the site.

The 1st Nara Exhibition held in the next year, 1875 exhibited calligraphic works and paintings, antique wears, specimens of animals and plants and machinery, etc. displayed by Shinto shrines, temples and people, including Shosoin treasures, using Daibutsu-den Hall (the Great Buddha hall) of Todai-ji Temple and corridors around the hall as the site.

The first Nara Exhibition held in the next year, 1875 exhibited calligraphic works and paintings, antique wears, specimens of animals and plants and machinery, etc. displayed by Shinto shrines, temples and people, including Shosoin treasures, using Daibutsu-den Hall (the Great Buddha hall) of Todai-ji Temple and corridors around the hall as the site.

sen.j: 80日間の会期中にのべ17万人が訪れる大盛況であったことが当時の記録からわかる。
sen.e: It is understood from the records those days that the exhibition was enthusiastically received with totally 170,000 visitors during a period of 80 days of the exhibition.
It is understood from the records those days that the exhibition was enthusiastically received with totally 170,000 visitors during a period of 80 days of the exhibition.
It is understood from the records those days that the exhibition was enthusiastically received with totally 170,000 visitors during a period of 80 days of the exhibition.

sen.j: その後奈良博覧会は1877年（明治10年）を除いて毎年開催され、1890年（明治23年）までに計15回を数えた。
sen.e: Thereafter, the Nara Exhibition was held every year, excluding 1877, and was held as much as 15 times totally by 1890.
Thereafter, the Nara Exhibition was held every year, excluding 1877, and was held as much as 15 times in total by 1890.
Thereafter, the Nara Exhibition was held every year, excluding 1877, and was held as much as 15 times in total by 1890.

sen.j: 当時、東京上野にはすでに宮内省所管の博物館（東京国立博物館の前身）があったが、1889年（明治22年）、宮内大臣通達により東京の博物館の名称を「帝国博物館」に改めるとともに、京都と奈良にもそれぞれ帝国博物館を設置することが決まった。
sen.e: Those days, there already was a museum under the jurisdiction of the Imperial Household Ministry (the predecessor of the Tokyo National Museum) in Ueno in Tokyo, however, in 1889, it was determined by the notification of the Imperial Household Minister that the name of the museum in Tokyo would be renamed to the 'Imperial Museum,' and that an imperial museum would also be established in Kyoto and Nara respectively.

Those days, there already was a museum under the jurisdiction of the Imperial Household Ministry (the predecessor of the Tokyo National Museum) in Ueno in Tokyo, however, in 1889, it was determined by the notification of the Imperial Household Minister that the name of the museum in Tokyo would be renamed to the 'Imperial Museum,' and that an imperial museum would also be established in Kyoto and Nara respectively.

Those days, there already was a museum under the jurisdiction of the Imperial Household Ministry (the predecessor of the Tokyo National Museum) in Ueno in Tokyo, however, in 1889, it was determined by the notification of the Imperial Household Minister that the name of the museum in Tokyo would be renamed to the 'Imperial Museum,' and that an imperial museum would also be established in Kyoto and Nara respectively.
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正

sen.j: こうして、興福寺旧境内である現在地で1892年（明治25年）より建設工事が始まり、1894年に本館が竣工、翌1895年に開館した。
sen.e: In this way, the construction of the museum started at the current location in the former premise of Kofuku-ji Temple from 1892, and the Original Museum Building was completed in 1894 and opened in the next year, 1895.

In this way, the construction of the museum started at the current location in the former premise of Kofuku-ji Temple from 1892, and the Original Museum Building was completed in 1894 and opened in the next year, 1895.

In this way, the construction of the museum started at the current location in the former premises of Kofuku-ji Temple from 1892, and the Original Museum Building was completed in 1894 and opened in the next year, 1895.

sen.j: 1900年（明治33年）には館名を奈良帝室博物館に改めている。
sen.e: The name of the museum was renamed to the Imperial Household Museum of Nara in 1900.
The name of the museum was renamed to the Imperial Household Museum of Nara in 1900.
The name of the museum was renamed to the Imperial Household Museum of Nara in 1900.

sen.j: この呼称は1947年（昭和22年）まで使われた。
sen.e: This name was used by 1947.
This name was used until 1947.
This name was used until 1947.

sen.j: 1947年、新憲法の公布とともに博物館は文部省に移管され、国立博物館奈良分館となった。
sen.e: In 1947, along with the promulgation of the new constitution, the museum came under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Education, and became Nara Branch Museum of the National Museum.
In 1947, along with the promulgation of the new constitution, the museum came under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Education, and became Nara Branch Museum of the National Museum.
In 1947, along with the promulgation of the new constitution, the museum came under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Education, and became Nara Branch Museum of the National Museum.

sen.j: 奈良国立博物館という名称に変わったのは1952年（昭和27年）からである。
sen.e: It is in 1952 when the name of the museum was renamed to Nara National Museum
It is in 1952 when the name of the museum was renamed to Nara National Museum
It is in 1952 when the name of the museum was renamed to Nara National Museum

sen.j: 所管は1950年（昭和25年）文化財保護委員会、1968年（昭和43年）文化庁に変更し、2001年（平成13年）からは独立行政法人国立博物館、2007年（平成19年）からは独立行政法人国立文化財機構の設置する博物館となっている。
sen.e: The jurisdiction was transferred to the Commission for Protection of Cultural Properties in 1950, and to the Agency for cultural affairs in 1968, and the museum became an Independent Administrative Institution National Museum in 2001, and in 2007, became a museum to be established by an Independent Administrative Institution, National Institutes for Cultural Heritage.

The jurisdiction was transferred to the Commission for Protection of Cultural Properties in 1950, and to the Agency for cultural affairs in 1968, and the museum became an Independent Administrative Institution National Museum in 2001, and in 2007, became a museum to be established by an Independent Administrative Institution, National Institutes for Cultural Heritage.

The jurisdiction was transferred to the Commission for Protection of Cultural Properties in 1950, and to the Agency for cultural affairs in 1968, and the museum became an Independent Administrative Institution National Museum in 2001, and in 2007, became a museum to be established by an Independent Administrative Institution, National Institutes for Cultural Heritage.

sen.j: その間、1972年には吉村順三の設計による新館が完成し、正倉院展は新館で開催されるようになる。
sen.e: During the period, New Wing was completed in 1972 after the design of Junzo YOSHIMURA, and the Shosoin ten came to be held in the New Wing.
During that period, New Wing was completed in 1972 after the design of Junzo YOSHIMURA, and the Shosoin ten came to be held in the New Wing.
During that period, New Wing was completed in 1972 after the design of Junzo YOSHIMURA, and the Shosoin ten came to be held in the New Wing.

sen.j: また、本館と新館は地下道で結ばれるようになる。
sen.e: In addition, the Original Museum Building was connected with the New Wing through an underground passage.
In addition, the Original Museum Building was connected with the New Wing through an underground passage.
In addition, the Original Museum Building was connected with the New Wing through an underground passage.

sen.j: 1997年には、やはり吉村順三の設計による東新館が完成し、従来の新館は西新館と改称する。
sen.e: In 1997, East Wing was completed also after the design of Junzo YOSHIMURA, and the existing New Wing was renamed to West Wing.
In 1997, East Wing was completed also after the design of Junzo YOSHIMURA, and the existing New Wing was renamed to West Wing.
In 1997, East Wing was completed also after the design of Junzo YOSHIMURA, and the existing New Wing was renamed to West Wing.

sen.j: 両新館は統一デザインを採用し景観の調和を図っている。
sen.e: Both Wings have created a harmonic landscape by adopting a unified design.
sen.cmt: 「図って」は"create"を使って訳出しています。
sen.e: Both Wings have created a harmonic landscape by adopting a unified design.
Both Wings have created a harmonic landscape by adopting a unified design.

sen.j: これに伴い新館側の入口が両新館の間に新設されたエントランスホールに変更され、本館を結ぶ地下道も新たに作られた「地下回廊」に変更され、ミュージアムショップや軽食ラウンジ、トイレや簡単な展示パネル、仏像の構造や印相の解説の展示などを備えた無料ゾーンとなっている。
sen.e: Along with this, the entrance of the Wings' side was changed to the entrance hall newly constructed between the Wings, and the underground passage connecting with the Original Museum Building was also changed to newly constructed 'Lower Level Passageway,' which has become a free zone equipped with a museum shop, café lounge, toilets, brief exhibition panels and exhibitions such as, structure of Buddha statues and commentary of mudras, etc.

Along with this, the entrance of the Wings' side was changed to the entrance hall newly constructed between the Wings, and the underground passage connecting with the Original Museum Building was also changed to newly constructed 'Lower Level Passageway,' which has become a free zone equipped with a museum shop, café lounge, toilets, brief exhibition panels and exhibitions such as, structure of Buddha statues and commentary of mudras, etc.

Along with this, the entrance of the Wings' side was changed to the entrance hall newly constructed between the Wings, and the underground passage connecting with the Original Museum Building was also changed to newly constructed 'Lower Level Passageway,' which has become a free zone equipped with a museum shop, cafe lounge, toilets, brief exhibition panels and exhibitions such as, structure of Buddha statues and commentary of mudras, etc.
sen.cmt: café→cafeとし、全角クォーテーション・アポストロフィーを半角に修正

sen.j: 2002年には古美術商店「不言堂」創業者坂本五郎から寄贈された大量の中国古代青銅器の展示スペースが本館付属棟（元は収蔵庫）に開設されている。
sen.e: In 2002, a space for exhibiting a large amount of Chinese ancient bronze wares donated by Goro SAKAMOTO, the founder of an antique art shop, 'Fugendo' was established in the Annex attached to the Original Museum Building (originally a repository).

In 2002, a space for exhibiting a large amount of Chinese ancient bronze wares donated by Goro SAKAMOTO, the founder of an antique art shop, 'Fugendo' was established in the Annex attached to the Original Museum Building (originally a repository).

In 2002, a space for exhibiting a large amount of Chinese ancient bronze wares donated by Goro SAKAMOTO, the founder of an antique art shop 'Fugendo,' was established in the Annex attached to the Original Museum Building (originally a repository).
sen.cmt: 全角クォーテーションを半角に修正、カンマの位置を移動

sen.j: なお、両新館は2階のみが展示室となっている。
sen.e: Further, only the 2nd floors of the both Wings have been used as exhibition rooms.
Further, only the 2nd floors of the both Wings have been used as exhibition rooms.
Further, only the second floors of the both Wings have been used as exhibition rooms.

sen.j: 和辻哲郎の『古寺巡礼』（1919年刊）にも当時の奈良帝室博物館が登場する。
sen.e: The Imperial Household Museum of Nara those days also appears in "Koji junrei" (A Pilgrimage to Ancient Temples) written by Tetsuro WATSUJI (published in 1919).
The Imperial Household Museum of Nara those days also appears in "Koji junrei" (A Pilgrimage to Ancient Temples) written by Tetsuro WATSUJI (published in 1919).
The Imperial Household Museum of Nara those days also appears in "Koji Junrei" (A Pilgrimage to Ancient Temples) written by Tetsuro WATSUJI (published in 1919).
sen.cmt: Koji Junreiとし、全角クォーテーションを半角に修正

sen.j: 当時の博物館には法隆寺の百済観音像、興福寺の阿修羅像などの、美術史上著名な作品が数多く寄託・展示されていた。
sen.e: Those days, many famous works of art in art history, including the statue of Kudara Kannon of Horyu-ji Temple, statue of Asura (fighting demon) of Kofuku-ji Temple, etc. were deposited and being exhibited in the museum.

Those days, many famous works of art in art history, including the statue of Kudara Kannon of Horyu-ji Temple, statue of Asura (fighting demon) of Kofuku-ji Temple, etc. were deposited and exhibited in the museum.

Those days, many famous works of art in art history, including the statue of Kudara Kannon of Horyu-ji Temple, statue of Asura (fighting demon) of Kofuku-ji Temple, etc. were deposited and exhibited in the museum.

sen.j: 第二次大戦後、各地の社寺において鉄筋コンクリートの宝物館・収蔵庫の新設が相次ぎ、博物館に寄託されていた仏像等は元の寺院に返還されるケースが多くなっている。
sen.e: After World War II, reinforced concrete treasure houses and depositories were newly established one after another in Shinto shrines and temples in each region, and there have been an increasing number of cases where the Buddha statues, etc. which had been deposited in the museum would be returned to the original temples.

After World War II, reinforced concrete treasure houses and depositories were newly established one after another in Shinto shrines and temples in each region, and there have been an increasing number of cases where the Buddha statues, etc. which had been deposited in the museum would be returned to the original temples.

After World War II, reinforced concrete treasure houses and depositories were newly established one after another in Shinto shrines and temples in each region, and there have been an increasing number of cases where the Buddha statues, etc. which had been deposited in the museum would be returned to the original temples.

sen.j: 1922年12月18日、来日していたアルベルト・アインシュタインが来館している。
sen.e: On December 18, 1922, Albert EINSTEIN visited the museum.
On December 18, 1922, Albert EINSTEIN visited the museum.
On December 18, 1922, Albert EINSTEIN visited the museum.

sen.j: 当日の日記には日本の芸術について深い印象を覚えた旨が記された。
sen.e: A note to the effect that he had felt deeply impressed with Japanese art was written in his diary for that day.
A note to the effect that he had felt deeply impressed with Japanese art was written in his diary for that day.
A note to the effect that he had felt deeply impressed with Japanese art was written in his diary for that day.

sen.e: The national treasures possessed by an Independent Administrative Institution, National Institutes for Cultural Heritage, and preserved in Nara National Museum are as follows.

sen.j: 四畳台目の席を主室とし、入母屋造り茅葺、前面に杮葺の庇をおろした田舎家風の外観である。
sen.e: It places a seat of yonjo daime (four and three-quarters tatami mats size of room in teahouse) as the main room, and has an appearance like a country house, built in a Irimoya-zukuri (building with a half-hipped roof) style, having a thatched roof and kakerabuki (shingling) eaves hung in the front.

It places a seat of yonjo daime (four and three-quarters tatami mats size of room in teahouse) as the main room, and has an appearance like a country house, built in a Irimoya-zukuri (building with a half-hipped roof) style, having a thatched roof and kakerabuki (shingling) eaves hung in the front.
